results.title: Hamburger hill
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Nasitir-Carabatsos, Interaccess, Marcia Nasatir, Jim Carabatos and John irvin
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnamese conflict in 1969, “Hamburger Hill” is a realistic, horrific dramatic depiction, almost documentary-like in format, of one of the bloodiest battles of the Vietnam War. The film follows the fortunes of 14 recruits through 10 days of hell as they make repeated assaults on a heavily fortified hill. The developing relationships between the young soldiers is tested by the grim realities of war and death. “Hamburger Hill” is a moving tribute to the men who fought a futile campaign which resulted in 70% of casualties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: RKO Radio Pictures, Nasitir-Carabatsos, Interaccess, Marcia Nasatir, Jim Carabatos and John irvin

results.title: Hamburger
results.brief_description: Hamburger focuses on the fast food industry; providing an insight into the two largest hamburger chains in the world; MacDonalds and Burger King. These two fast food chains have made a dramatic impact, not only on the food industry itself; but on the social and economic lives of individuals. The fast food market has been revolutionised into an industrial process which has had a serious impact on the environment. A powerful documentary in two episodes: Big Mac” and “International Mincemeat.

results.title: Hamam: the Turkish bath
results.creator_credit: Sorpasso Film, Marco Risi, Maurizio Tedesco and Ferzan Ozpetec
results.brief_description: This Italian-Turkish co-production is the story of a successful Italian businessman, Francesco, who goes to Istanbul to settle the estate of his estranged Aunt. In Turkey he encounters his Aunt’s surrogate family and decides to stay on in Istanbul and restore an old hamam (Turkish bath). Francesco finds that not only is he attracted to the generosity of his new “family”, he also finds himself sexually attracted to the son, Mehmet. When his wife Marta arrives from Italy they find themselves locked in a bitter exchange that strips bare the lies and evasions that underpin their marriage. For both Marta and Francesco, the city of Istanbul - half European, half Asian - comes to symbolise a freedom, a romance and a community that is no longer available in the fast-paced materialistic culture of Western Europe. And for both of them, with the destruction of their marriage and the intervention of violent tragedy, they discover themselves recreating the Aunt’s original exile. Filmed in location in Istanbul, this is the first film of Turkish director Ferzan Ozpetac. Cast includes Allessandro Gassman and Francesca d’Aloja. In Italian and Turkish with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of two Golden Globe Awards for Best First Film and for Best Musical Score)

results.title: Halprin: collective creativity
results.brief_description: Lawrence Halprin, environmental designer, explains his successful approach designing cities for the care and feeding of people, rather than the care and feeding of automobiles. His “take part” workshops draw people together to create their own consensus of how they want their cities to change or be revitalised
results.description: Lawrence Halprin, environmental designer, explains his successful approach designing cities for the care and feeding of people, rather than the care and feeding of automobiles. results.title: Halloween (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Debra Hill, Falcon Film and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s much imitated Halloween defined the eighties stalk and slash genre, spawning inferior copies like the Friday the 13th series (including six sequels of it’s own) and for a time making star Jamie Lee Curtis into the premium ‘scream queen’. Later on the conventions of the genre were cleverly re-invented for a nineties audience by director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson in Scream, which pays direct homage to Halloween. John Carpenter opens his film with an unnerving point of view shot of the young psychotic Michael Myers brutally stabbing his teenage sister to death on Halloween night. Flash forward to Halloween 15 years later and Michael has escaped the mental institution he has been locked up in. Meanwhile shy, virginal teenager Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her girlfriends are preparing for Halloween, unaware of the menace that lurks in their quiet suburban community. Carpenter makes great use of the sparse, atmospheric music score (which he also composed) and uses to maximum creepy effect the white mask Michael Myers wears throughout the film. The film also established the classic horror genre rule if your a sexually active teenager, you die! Also staring: Donald Pleasence, P.J. Soles, Tony Moran.

results.title: Halloween
results.creator_credit: Debra Hill, Falcon Film and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s much imitated “Halloween” defined the eighties stalk and slasher genre, spawning inferior copies like the “Friday the 13th” series (including six sequels of its own), and for a time making the star Jamie Lee Curtis into the premium “scream queen”. Later on the conventions of the genre were clevely re-invented for a nineties audience by director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson in “Scream”, which plays direct homage to “Halloween”. John Carpenter opens his film with an unnerving point of view shot of the young psychotic Michael Myers brutally stabbing his teenage sister to death on Halloween night. Flash forward to Halloween fifteen years later and Michael has escaped the mental institution he had been locked up in. Meanwhile shy, virginal teacher Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her girlfriends are preparing for Halloween, unaware of the menace that lurks in their quiet suburban community. Carpenter makes great use of the sparse, atmospheric music score (which he also composed), and uses to the maximum creepy effect the white mask Michael Myers wears throughout the film. “Halloween” also establishes the classic horror genre rule - if you’re a sexually active teenager, you die! Cast also includes Donald Pleasence, P.J. Soles, Tony Moran.

results.title: Hallo: communications in a nutshell
results.creator_credit: Unesco, Bucharest Studios and Jehangir Bhownagary
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon film giving a brief popular outline of the history of communications from signal drums to satellite relaying. No commentary - music by Dumitru Capoianu.
results.description: An animated cartoon film giving a brief popular outline of the history of communications from signal drums to satellite relaying. No commentary - music by Dumitru Capoianu.

results.title: Hallmarking
results.creator_credit: Jack Holmes, Kenneth Myer Productions, Goldsmith's Company of London and Andrew Holmes
results.brief_description: Traces the history of hall-marking and the evolution of different marks. Hall-marks represent a guarantee of quality and are based on stringent tests. Shows modern gold and silverware being tested at the London Assay Office. The different stages in the analysis are seen in detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Holmes, Kenneth Myer Productions, Goldsmith’s Company of London and Andrew Holmes

results.title: Halley
results.creator_credit: Terence Murtagh and York Films of England
results.brief_description: Provides a historical look at Halley’s Comet; considers work of Halley; notes popularity of comet watching in eighteenth and nineteenth century and briefly shows how NASA space vehicle “Giotto” will rendezvous with Halley’s comet in 1986.
